Determinant 𓏠 𓈖

Originally 𓏠 𓈖 was maybe just a determinant like "number" or "remainder" however as the 𓋴 part of eight became more and more corroded or ambivalent, it became necessary custom to persistently add 𓏠 𓈖 in order to avoid confusion with many other words that sounded like 𓋴.

Al-Ashmunayn Ashmunein Ashmounein 𐄎𓅱𓏌𓊖𓏏 "City of the Eight / Ogdoad" Ϣⲙⲟⲩⲛ Shmun 𓋉 Khemenu ḫmnw Hermoⁿpolis

𓄤 𓄣 𓏠 𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤 𓇋𓇋 𓅱 𓀭 𓏪 Ogdoad 𓋴|𓋴 ὀγδοάς "the Eightfold" ḫmnyw, a plural nisba of ḫmnw "eight"

🕷 (8-leg) עַכָּבִישׁ akavísh ἀράχνη arákhnē aragne arachno
🕷 (8-leg) armiarmaⁿ merimangã 𓏱 murgañu damang ñandu мияма miyama möýᵒⁿ
🕷 แมงมุม mɛɛng-mum ⇔ 八 𓏠 𓈖 ⇔ 𓋴 𓏠 𓈖 Spinne spiel spinning “spider”

Since 𓋴 𓏠 𓈖 is so strongly associated with 𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 the deep semantic relationship of
𓋴 𓏠 𓈖 is probably 24 or 42, since 𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 mammals only have four legs.

What does a beast 𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 ᴽ have to do with number 8 in a pantheon context?
Maybe it was the 8th cosmic entitiy after the 5 known planets plus sun and moon.
But what was it?
𒀯 MUL Milkyway?
𒀯 MUL Multitude of starry sky?
𒀯𒀯 Zodiac of 7 pleiades ? (7 is 8th digit starting from 0) but visually only 6 (plus doubling)!?

Note that 5 planets and stars 𓃀 𓇼 were similar concepts before modern science.

𓋴 𓃀 𓇼 spider compatibility is probably coincidental, or is it:

𒀯𒄈𒋰 Zuqaqīpu Scorpio •S-GÍR-PU (sic!)
